8a011ad1-bb84-49e7-8d34-f0b44cf1c8b8.title: Library Managment System
8a011ad1-bb84-49e7-8d34-f0b44cf1c8b8.original_text:
The Member clicks the log-in button on the Home Page. The system displays the log- in page. The member enters his login Id with password. The member clicks on the confirm button. The system checks that all of the required information was entered. If the entered information is wrong then system asks member to reenter the details. The system validates the entered information against the tables stored in the database. Member must be logged in to the system. The member clicks on View user details. The system opens a page showing the details of the member. The details include the total number of issued books, date of issue, return date, fine to be paid. The member closes the page. The system shows OK message. The books should be stored in database. The books must be ready to retrieve. The system asks user to login. The system identifies the type of user- member, guest or administrator. The system shows the categories to browse. The user selects a category of books to view. If no category is selected by the user then the system again asks user to select a category. The system checks the books in the database. The system retrieves all the books falling in that category. The user selects the desired books. The system shows the details of the selected books. The system asks user to print the details. If User does not want to print the details then user can ignore the step. User can reserve a book by inputting the relevant details & the librarian can also reserve a book for a member. User should be logged into the system. User should have correct book Id. Books should be available to reserve. The system asks user to login. The system identifies the type of user- member, guest or administrator. The system shows the categories to browse. The user selects book to reserve. If no book is selected by the user then the system again asks user to select a book to reserve. The user enters Book Id to reserve. If the book Id is wrong then system asks user to recheck the book id. The system checks the books in the database. If the selected book is already reserved on another Id then system asks user to select another book. Members should be logged into the system. Guest user can also search books. Book should be available to search. The system shows the categories to browse. The member selects a category of searching a book. If no category is selected by the member then the system again asks user to select a category. The system checks the books in the database. The system retrieves all the books falling in that category. Member should give the member Id to the librarian. Books should be available to issue. The librarian Checks the availability of the books. The librarian also checks total number of books issued on that Id. Librarian issues the book. The librarian cannot issue the books if the user has three books issued on his Id. The system updates the information in database. Librarian should be logged into the system. Member should have borrowed books. Member should give the member Id to the librarian. The member returns the book. The librarian enters book id , member id in the system. If the entered book id is incorrect then system asks to re-enter the book id. The system prompts a message that the book with book id is successfully returned. Members should be stored in the database. Members should be available to retrieve by the system. Member must be logged in to the system. Guest can also view members. The user clicks on View members. The system opens a page showing the details of the member. The details include name of member, the total number of issued books, date of issue, return date, fine to be paid. The member closes the page. Librarian should be logged into the system. Books should be available to remove. Book details should be
 
available to add or remove books in the database. The librarian has option of adding or removing a book in database. The system asks librarian to add or remove the book. The librarian adds a book. The system asks librarian to enter all the required details about the new book to be added. The librarian enters the details. If the librarian selects to remove a book then the book should be outdated. The system administrator that all the information has been correctly provided. Administrator should be logged into the system. Member should be available to remove. Member details should be available to add or remove member in the database. The system asks administrator to add or remove a member. The administrator selects to add a member. The system asks administrator to enter all the required details about the new member to be added. The administrator enters the details. If the administrator selects to remove a member then a valid reason of removal is required. The system validates that all the information has been correctly provided.

ai_result.snl_text:
1. The system shall provide the Member with the ability to click the log-in button on the Home Page.
2. The system shall display the log-in page when the Member clicks the log-in button.
3. The system shall be able to check that all required information (login Id and password) is entered when the Member clicks on the confirm button.
4. If the entered information is incorrect, then the system shall ask the Member to reenter the details.
5. The system shall validate the entered information against the tables stored in the database to ensure the Member is logged in.
6. The system shall provide the Member with the ability to click on "View user details" to see information such as total number of issued books, dates, and fines.
7. The system shall open a page showing the Member's details when the Member clicks on "View user details."
8. The system shall display an OK message when the Member closes the page.
9. The system shall store books in the database and ensure they are ready to retrieve.
10. The system shall identify the type of user (member, guest, or administrator) upon login.
11. The system shall show categories of books to browse after user identification.
12. The system shall retrieve and display books falling under the selected category by the user.
13. The system shall show details of the selected books and ask the user to print the details.
14. The system shall allow the user to reserve a book by inputting relevant details or allow the librarian to reserve a book for a member.
15. The system shall check the availability of the selected book for reservation and prompt the user to recheck the book id if incorrect.
16. The system shall allow guest users to search for available books.
17. The system shall prompt the member to provide their member Id to the librarian for issuing books.
18. The librarian shall check the availability of books and the total number of books issued to the member before issuing a book.
19. The librarian shall not be able to issue books if the member already has three books issued on their Id.
20. The system shall update book information in the database upon book issuance by the librarian.
21. The librarian shall be able to remove books from the database and update book details.
22. The librarian shall have the option to add a new book by entering all required details about the book.
23. The system shall prompt the librarian to add or remove a book and handle the process accordingly.
24. The system shall allow the administrator to add or remove a member by entering all required details about the new member.
25. If the administrator selects to remove a member, a valid reason for removal must be provided.
26. The system shall validate that all information provided by the administrator for adding or removing a member is correct.
requirements: The system shall provide the Member with the ability to click the log-in button on the Home Page.
The system shall display the log-in page when the Member clicks the log-in button.
The system shall be able to check that all required information (login Id and password) is entered when the Member clicks on the confirm button.
If the entered information is incorrect, then the system shall ask the Member to reenter the details.
The system shall validate the entered information against the tables stored in the database to ensure the Member is logged in.
The system shall provide the Member with the ability to click on "View user details" to see information such as total number of issued books, dates, and fines.
The system shall open a page showing the Member's details when the Member clicks on "View user details."
The system shall display an OK message when the Member closes the page.
The system shall store books in the database and ensure they are ready to retrieve.
The system shall identify the type of user (member, guest, or administrator) upon login.
The system shall show categories of books to browse after user identification.
The system shall retrieve and display books falling under the selected category by the user.
The system shall show details of the selected books and ask the user to print the details.
The system shall allow the user to reserve a book by inputting relevant details or allow the librarian to reserve a book for a member.
The system shall check the availability of the selected book for reservation and prompt the user to recheck the book id if incorrect.
The system shall allow guest users to search for available books.
The system shall prompt the member to provide their member Id to the librarian for issuing books.
The librarian shall check the availability of books and the total number of books issued to the member before issuing a book.
The librarian shall not be able to issue books if the member already has three books issued on their Id.
The system shall update book information in the database upon book issuance by the librarian.
The librarian shall be able to remove books from the database and update book details.
The librarian shall have the option to add a new book by entering all required details about the book.
The system shall prompt the librarian to add or remove a book and handle the process accordingly.
The system shall allow the administrator to add or remove a member by entering all required details about the new member.
If the administrator selects to remove a member, a valid reason for removal must be provided.
The system shall validate that all information provided by the administrator for adding or removing a member is correct.
ai_result.raw_response:
1. The system shall provide the Member with the ability to click the log-in button on the Home Page.
2. The system shall display the log-in page when the Member clicks the log-in button.
3. The system shall be able to check that all required information (login Id and password) is entered when the Member clicks on the confirm button.
4. If the entered information is incorrect, then the system shall ask the Member to reenter the details.
5. The system shall validate the entered information against the tables stored in the database to ensure the Member is logged in.
6. The system shall provide the Member with the ability to click on "View user details" to see information such as total number of issued books, dates, and fines.
7. The system shall open a page showing the Member's details when the Member clicks on "View user details."
8. The system shall display an OK message when the Member closes the page.
9. The system shall store books in the database and ensure they are ready to retrieve.
10. The system shall identify the type of user (member, guest, or administrator) upon login.
11. The system shall show categories of books to browse after user identification.
12. The system shall retrieve and display books falling under the selected category by the user.
13. The system shall show details of the selected books and ask the user to print the details.
14. The system shall allow the user to reserve a book by inputting relevant details or allow the librarian to reserve a book for a member.
15. The system shall check the availability of the selected book for reservation and prompt the user to recheck the book id if incorrect.
16. The system shall allow guest users to search for available books.
17. The system shall prompt the member to provide their member Id to the librarian for issuing books.
18. The librarian shall check the availability of books and the total number of books issued to the member before issuing a book.
19. The librarian shall not be able to issue books if the member already has three books issued on their Id.
20. The system shall update book information in the database upon book issuance by the librarian.
21. The librarian shall be able to remove books from the database and update book details.
22. The librarian shall have the option to add a new book by entering all required details about the book.
23. The system shall prompt the librarian to add or remove a book and handle the process accordingly.
24. The system shall allow the administrator to add or remove a member by entering all required details about the new member.
25. If the administrator selects to remove a member, a valid reason for removal must be provided.
26. The system shall validate that all information provided by the administrator for adding or removing a member is correct.

out_of_scope.requirement: The system shall provide the Member with the ability to click on "View user details" to see information such as total number of issued books, dates, and fines.

The system shall open a page showing the Member's details when the Member clicks on "View user details."
8.
The system shall allow the user to reserve a book by inputting relevant details or allow the librarian to reserve a book for a member.
The librarian shall check the availability of books and the total number of books issued to the member before issuing a book.
The librarian shall have the option to add a new book by entering all required details about the book.
